item.title: Best Games Releasing During Holiday 2025
item.content:encoded:
The Holiday season covers the months of November, December, and January. Most of the biggest game releases happen outside of this period, but there’s still plenty of the best games releasing in Holiday 2025.

As 2025 begins to wind down, players are peppered with massive games from August through to October. The season starts again around February and March. Sandwiched in this is the Holiday season, and 2025 still has the odd homerun to knock out of the park first.

Also, for even more holiday shopping guides, check out Insider Gaming’s Holiday 2025 hub for the best deals available.

The Best Video Games For Holiday 2025

Football Manager 26

Absence makes the heart grow fonder. It’s incredible to think it’s been two years since the last FM game. But Sports Interactive finally dropped Football Manager 26, and while it’s one of the worst games ever rated on Steam, it’s selling like hotcakes!

It would make a nice present under the tree, and is sure to eat up any free time you have.

Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment

The Dynasty Warrior-like combat and gameplay aesthetics are back in The Legend of Zelda, thanks to Age of Imprisonment. It carries on the spin-offs’ focus on large-scale combat over cave exploration and puzzles, but it makes for one of the most unique Zelda games of all time.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 7

Black Ops 7 is the next Call of Duty game, and it doesn’t matter how it reviews, it’s guaranteed to be under most Christmas trees for Holiday 2025. It doesn’t have to be the best game; it just has to be Call of Duty—which it is. Insider Gaming understands this, which is why you can get money off the heavy-hitter below.

Kirby Air Riders

Stand back, Mario Kart World, there’s a new racing game speeding onto the Nintendo Switch 2. Mario Kart World was the guaranteed winner for the Switch 2 in 2025, and Kirby Air Riders whistled through and turned out to be a pleasant competitor. It brings back a fairly niche franchise into the mainstream again.

Metroid Prime 4: Beyond

The Metroid Prime 4: Beyond journey has been stressful, but potentially rewarding. Metroid Prime 4 was starting to slip into the void and become another Beyond Good & Evil 2. It finally reappeared, and now it’s set to grace Nintendo Switch 2 consoles for the Holiday 2025 season, and it’s one of the most anticipated games—one you should probably buy if you have the console!

Code Vein 2

The original Code Vein was Bandai Namco’s solo attempt to crack the Souls genre market. It didn’t quite reach the levels of a FromSoftware game, but its enchanting art style and sales were enough to captivate Bandai into giving the franchise another chance. Code Vein 2 is one of 2026’s first big games.

Check out the Insider Gaming Discord server to let people know which games you’re picking up, and if IG has missed any big games from this Holiday 2025 list!

NOTE: Insider Gaming may earn affiliate commission if you purchase items through links on Insider Gaming. Read more about affiliate commission here.

item.title: Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment Version 1.02 Patch Notes—New Missions, Weapons, Improvements
item.content:encoded:
The new update and patch notes for Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment, Version 1.02, are out now for Nintendo Switch 2. With it, new quests, weapons, and fixes have been added.

Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment is the newest entry in the Hyrule Warriors spinoffs for The Legend of Zelda. In it, fans get to see the original Guardians that took a stand against Ganon, which is shown in flashbacks in Tears of the Kingdom. The Musou hack-and-slash combat and colorful visuals are well worth it, especially on Nintendo Switch 2, but now, there’s a lot more to get excited about with Version 1.02.

For Version 1.02 of Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment, available now, there’s some new content to enjoy. The biggest of all are new battles and quests, which are unlocked after beating the main story. New stylish Sync-Strike Attacks between Zelda and Calamo have been added, as well as the Longsword of Light for Rauru. Furthermore, some improvements to split-screen and UI have been addressed and fixed.

Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment Version 1.02 Full Patch Notes

The full patch notes for Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment Version 1.02 are available below and on the official Nintendo website.

Features added

New quests added:

  • Multiple challenges and quests were added as an element of clearing the main game.
  • New “Vicious Enemies” for Bokoblin and Sludge Like now appear. “Fuse Attacks” like “Boko Rapid Spin” that are performed using materials from “Vicious Bokoblins” will be incredibly powered up compared to past materials.

New weapons added:

  • Added the Longsword of Light, a special long sword that Rauru granted the protection of the power of light to, and the High Guard’s Spear, a spear issued to the bravest warriors serving the king of Hyrule.
  • You can acquire these by clearing battles that are added in this update.

New exclusive Sync Strikes:

  • Exclusive Sync Strikes added for Zelda and Calamo.
  • Zelda will return a boomerang that Calamo throws using the Power of Time and follow up. If the player can press the X Button with good timing, she will catch the boomerang and the attack will become powerful.
  • You can learn these by clearing the quests that are added in this update.

Fighting alongside Flux Construct:

  • You will now be able to perform Sync Strikes with Flux Constructs. These powerful spin attacks will scatter minor enemies, and chip away at the Weak Point Gauge of powerful enemies.
  • You will be able to perform this in existing battles where Flux Constructs appear in addition to the battles that are added in this update.

New battles added:

  • “Eve of the Final Confrontation”
  • “In Search of Poes”
  • “The Struggle for Ash Swamp”

Improved Features

Actions:

  • Special actions for the mysterious construct can now be saved for each weapon type.
  • Added a warning sound before the effects of the unique skills “Power Surge” and “Boundless Energy” end.

Battles:

  • You can now select characters and weapons in “The Tanagar Meditation Hall.”
  • A preview of the health recovery amount is now displayed when selecting “Special Rations” or “Battery.”

Deployment Preparations Screen:

  • From the “Allies” screen during deployment preparation, you can now press the Y Button to jump to the “Aside Quests.”

The Hyrule Map:

  • Added tutorials displayed on the Hyrule map to the list.
  • You can now visualize how ground areas are divided on the Hyrule map.
  • When hovering over a battle, a preview of the area you can reclaim is now displayed.

Quests:

  • Changed the color of the text on the quests list to yellow for items that can be cleared. Adjusted the clear status display of quests.

Fixed issues

  • The Unique Skill “Construct Launch” would not gain the effect of some special effects or enhancements.
  • Aside Quest “Defeat — enemies using Zonai device” would not be counted even the player fulfilled the conditions for strong attacks using Zonai gear or aerial combat.
  • Even if the weapon art “May Guard Automatically, Shocking/Freezing/Burning Enemies” was triggered with the Frox’s attack and the player guarded automatically, the enemy would not go into the elemental state that would be expected.
  • If the player does “Control Character” from the Pause Menu, there were times when the enhanced state would be undone.
  • When selecting “Retry” after particular control actions, there were times when the background music would no longer play.
  • It would be impossible to progress when using GameShare.
  • When communication would stop while using GameShare, attacks would not land on particular enemies.
  • When playing two-player split screen, there would be times when the player would return to “The Hyrule Map” when selecting “Retry” after particular control actions.
  • When playing two-player split screen, the camera controls would go in reverse when performing a Sync Strike with Pinnec.
  • Issues with certain screen displays.

What do you think of the new changes for Version 1.02 of Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment? Excited to play the new quests? How does it rank for Zelda spin-offs? Leave your thoughts in the comments and on the official Insider Gaming Discord!

For more Zelda news, check out these articles on the Legend of Zelda film and LEGO sets. Make sure to subscribe to our weekly newsletter!
